BIO

A dynamic, results-driven IT professional, with over 15 years’ experience in the field of front-end development and full stack development, Application development and design, Networking, SharePoint administration and development backed with MCSE Qualifications and other globally recognised qualifications.

2016 - Current

St Vincent's Health Australia

Senior Web Developer

This role is responsible for Implementing content for St Vincent’s Health Australia’s intranet, internet and external web publications. Assisting with the Implementation for interactive multimedia frameworks to disseminate information to a number of key internal and external stakeholders. Ensuring a robust and reliable web platform is supplied to the business and assist with implementing new technologies to meet business requirements

2011 - 2016

St Vincent’s Hospital, Melbourne

Senior SharePoint Administrator / Developer

This role was responsible for technical support and implementation of SharePoint 2010 as an Intranet / Collaboration Tool for St Vincent’s. Involved developing, project managing and maintaining the SharePoint Web environment (intranet & internet) for St. Vincent’s Health (STV) to ensure the Web environment provides a strategic portal for rapid, easy information access and self-management. Role also involved Developing and Building web applications utilizing the latest technologies to meet business requirements / solutions that cannot be delivered via third party solutions.

2007 - 2011

St Vincent’s Hospital, Melbourne

Web Developer

This role was as a Web Developer was to develop, manage and maintain the current Web infrastructure (intranet & internet) for St. Vincent’s Health (SVH) to ensure the Web environment provided a robust environment for sharing information. Involved recommending and introducing new technologies and applications to meet the demands within the Health Industry.

2004 - 2007

St Vincent’s Hospital, Melbourne

Senior Network Engineer

This role as a Senior Systems Engineer was responsible for technical support of the St Vincent’s Hospital network Infrastructure. It included BAU and project tasks as part of a daily routine. BAU tasks undertaken included (but were not limited to) administration and maintenance of highly available Windows Servers, applications, and data storage. Project work included yearly disaster recovery availability assessments, security patching as well as more specific projects such as the introduction of trend Micro as an enterprise anti-virus solution. I was the technical lead for the ISA, SMS, Web environments, the Enterprise Anti-virus environment and the Backup solution. I was also part of the after-hours on-call rota.
